name: GAM 355 Unusual Interaction
description:
This is another game in my series of Solo Game Development course, this time based on unusual interactions and the Warioware series. For unusual interactions, it had to be something you don't see often or a lot in games, hence the reference of Warioware-esque microgames comes into play. Often weird and strange, but quick and easy to play, they allowed for a lot of creativity. For my game, I used the example of a Bee, flying around, collecting pollen and going back to the hive after they got all three flowers. Bees aren't in a lot of games, nor is their job in games either. 

Use the mouse to move around and collect pollen from all three flowers (go over them) and then return to the hive! You have 5 seconds!

Art all done by me.

Used: 

https://answers.unity.com/questions/1076409/how-to-make-a-game-object-follow-the... for knowledge on how to get the bee to follow the mouse. I was never taught on Camera.main.screentoworldpoint.
